intro: Drypetes natalensis, commonly known as Natal woodbine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish-green flowers that are often obscured by bracts. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
